title: Weighted spatial tessellations in constrained domains
text: Spatial allocation around point locations recurring requirement ecology social‚Äìecological research, including delineation settlement influence zones, species territories, management areas. Voronoi tessellations provide simple transparent framework dividing space among generators, standard implementations assume uniform influence unconstrained Euclidean distance. weightedVoronoi package extends framework allowing () generator-specific weights (ii) tessellations constrained arbitrary polygonal domains using either Euclidean geodesic distance. vignette demonstrates use package representative example complex domain boundary.

title: Weighted spatial tessellations in constrained domains
text: first define concave, irregular spatial domain set generator points heterogeneous weights.
code: library(sf) library(weightedVoronoi)  crs_use <- 32636  # projected CRS (metres)  boundary_sf <- make_irregular_boundary()  set.seed(42)  pts <- st_sample(boundary_sf, size = 8, type = "random") points_sf <- st_sf(   village = paste0("V", seq_along(pts)),   population = round(exp(rnorm(length(pts), log(300), 0.8))),   geometry = pts,   crs = crs_use )  plot(st_geometry(boundary_sf), border = "black", lwd = 2) plot(st_geometry(points_sf), add = TRUE, pch = 21, bg = "red")

title: Weighted spatial tessellations in constrained domains
text: first generate weighted tessellation using Euclidean distance. Generator influence scaled using logarithmic transformation population weights.
code: out_euc <- weighted_voronoi_domain(   points_sf = points_sf,   weight_col = "population",   boundary_sf = boundary_sf,   res = 10,   weight_transform = log10,   distance = "euclidean",   clip_to_boundary = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE )  plot(st_geometry(boundary_sf), border = "black", lwd = 2) plot(out_euc$polygons["generator_id"], add = TRUE) plot(st_geometry(points_sf), add = TRUE, pch = 21, bg = "red")

title: Weighted spatial tessellations in constrained domains
text: now generate tessellation using geodesic distance, distances constrained paths entirely within domain.
code: out_geo <- weighted_voronoi_domain(   points_sf = points_sf,   weight_col = "population",   boundary_sf = boundary_sf,   res = 10,   weight_transform = log10,   distance = "geodesic",   close_mask = TRUE,   close_iters = 1,   verbose = FALSE )  plot(st_geometry(boundary_sf), border = "black", lwd = 2) plot(out_geo$polygons["generator_id"], add = TRUE) plot(st_geometry(points_sf), add = TRUE, pch = 21, bg = "red")

title: Weighted spatial tessellations in constrained domains
text: many ecological social‚Äìecological applications, effective distance shaped domain geometry also environmental resistance. Topography, land cover, infrastructure may increase cost movement locations. accommodate , weightedVoronoi allows geodesic distance calculations modified isotropic resistance surface. digital elevation model (DEM) supplied use_tobler = TRUE, movement cost adjusted using Tobler‚Äôs hiking function, increases effective distance across steep slopes.
code: library(sf) library(terra) library(weightedVoronoi)  # 1) Use a projected CRS (metres) crs_use <- 32636  # 2) Define a rectangular boundary (fast + robust for demos) boundary_sf <- st_sf(   geometry = st_sfc(st_polygon(list(rbind(     c(0, 0),     c(1200, 0),     c(1200, 800),     c(0, 800),     c(0, 0)   )))),   crs = crs_use )  # 3) Sample generator points INSIDE boundary (guaranteed inside) set.seed(1) n_pts <- 8 pts <- st_sample(boundary_sf, size = n_pts, type = "random")  points_sf <- st_sf(   id = seq_len(length(pts)),   population = round(exp(rnorm(length(pts), log(300), 0.8))),  # skewed weights   geometry = pts,   crs = crs_use )  # Sanity check (should be all TRUE) inside <- st_within(points_sf, boundary_sf, sparse = FALSE)[, 1] stopifnot(all(inside))  # 4) Choose resolution (cellsize) ‚Äî keep consistent everywhere cellsize <- 10 bnd_v <- terra::vect(boundary_sf)  # 5) Create a synthetic DEM with a strong ridge (easy to see) dem <- terra::rast(   ext = terra::ext(bnd_v),   resolution = cellsize,   crs = terra::crs(bnd_v) )  xy <- terra::crds(dem, df = TRUE)  # Ridge parameters (tweak height to strengthen/weaken effect) y0 <- (min(xy$y) + max(xy$y)) / 2 sigma <- (max(xy$y) - min(xy$y)) / 14 height <- 1000  terra::values(dem) <- height * exp(-((xy$y - y0)^2) / (2 * sigma^2))  par(mfrow = c(1,1)) # Optional plot check plot(st_geometry(boundary_sf), border = "black", lwd = 2, main = "Demo inputs") plot(st_geometry(points_sf), add = TRUE, pch = 21, bg = "red")   out_geo_plain <- weighted_voronoi_domain(   points_sf = points_sf,   weight_col = "population",   boundary_sf = boundary_sf,   res = cellsize,   weight_transform = log10,   distance = "geodesic",   verbose = FALSE )  out_geo_dem <- weighted_voronoi_domain(   points_sf = points_sf,   weight_col = "population",   boundary_sf = boundary_sf,   res = cellsize,   weight_transform = log10,   distance = "geodesic",   dem_rast = dem,   use_tobler = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE )   plot(sf::st_geometry(boundary_sf), border = "black", lwd = 2) plot(out_geo_plain$polygons["generator_id"], main = "Geodesic", add = TRUE) plot(sf::st_geometry(points_sf), add = TRUE, pch = 21, bg = "red")  plot(sf::st_geometry(boundary_sf), border = "black", lwd = 2) plot(out_geo_dem$polygons["generator_id"], main = "Geodesic + Tobler ridge resistance", add = TRUE) plot(sf::st_geometry(points_sf), add = TRUE, pch = 21, bg = "red")

title: Weighted spatial tessellations in constrained domains
text: Although tessellations fully partition domain, differ influence propagates concave boundaries narrow corridors. Euclidean tessellation allocates regions based straight-line distance within rasterised domain, whereas geodesic tessellation respects domain geometry prevents influence across inaccessible areas. differences reflected visually generator-level summary tables returned software.

title: Weighted spatial tessellations in constrained domains
text: Resolution: Smaller raster cell sizes improve boundary fidelity increase computation time. Weights: Alternative weight transformations (e.g.¬†square-root power-law) can supplied reflect different assumptions generator influence. Distance metric: Geodesic distance recommended domain geometry strongly constrains access interaction.

title: Weighted spatial tessellations in constrained domains
text: vignette illustrates weightedVoronoi can used generate reproducible, weighted spatial tessellations respect complex boundaries heterogeneous generator influence. approach provides flexible alternative standard Voronoi methods ecological social‚Äìecological applications.

title: weightedVoronoi
text: Tools weighted spatial tessellation using Euclidean geodesic distances within constrained polygons. Produces complete, connected partitions respect complex boundaries heterogeneous point weights. üåê Website: https://HarriRaven.github.io/weightedVoronoi/

what: Use a projected CRS (units in metres)
title: weightedVoronoi
weightedVoronoi
code: boundary_sf <- st_sf(   geometry = st_sfc(     st_polygon(list(rbind(       c(0, 0),       c(1000, 0),       c(1000, 1000),       c(0, 1000),       c(0, 0)     )))   ),   crs = crs_use )

title: weightedVoronoi
code: points_sf <- st_sf(   village = paste0("V", 1:5),   population = c(50, 200, 1000, 150, 400),   geometry = st_sfc(     st_point(c(200, 200)),     st_point(c(800, 250)),     st_point(c(500, 500)),     st_point(c(250, 800)),     st_point(c(750, 750))   ),   crs = crs_use )

title: weightedVoronoi
code: out_euc <- weighted_voronoi_domain(   points_sf = points_sf,   weight_col = "population",   boundary_sf = boundary_sf,   res = 20,   weight_transform = log10,   distance = "euclidean",   verbose = FALSE )

what: Weighted geodesic tessellation (domain-constrained shortest path distance)
title: weightedVoronoi
code: out_geo <- weighted_voronoi_domain(   points_sf = points_sf,   weight_col = "population",   boundary_sf = boundary_sf,   res = 20,   weight_transform = log10,   distance = "geodesic",   close_mask = TRUE,   close_iters = 1,   verbose = FALSE )

previous_headings: Installation > Generator points with weights > Weighted geodesic tessellation (domain-constrained shortest path distance)
title: weightedVoronoi
text: weightedVoronoi supports geodesic tessellations incorporate environmental resistance. supplied elevation raster, distances modified using Tobler‚Äôs hiking function, allowing topography influence spatial allocation.

title: weightedVoronoi
text: weighted_voronoi_domain() returns: polygons: sf object one polygon per generator (attributes) allocation: terra::SpatRaster assigning raster cell generator summary: generator-level summary table (area, share, weights, etc.) diagnostics: diagnostics settings (coverage, unreachable fraction geodesic, etc.)

title: weightedVoronoi
text: Inputs must projected CRS metric units (e.g.¬†metres). res controls raster resolution therefore trade-speed boundary fidelity. Geodesic tessellations typically slower Euclidean tessellations shortest-path distances computed within domain. Citation use weightedVoronoi, please cite associated software note.

title: Weighted Euclidean tessellation (core) ‚Äî weighted_voronoi
text: Internal/core function used weighted_voronoi_domain() compute weighted Euclidean tessellation rasterised domain.

title: Weighted Euclidean tessellation (core) ‚Äî weighted_voronoi
code: weighted_voronoi(   points_sf,   weight_col,   boundary = NULL,   template_rast = NULL,   res = NULL,   weight_transform = function(w) w,   method = c("argmin", "partition"),   max_dist = NULL,   verbose = TRUE,   island_min_cells = 5,   island_fill_iter = 50 )

title: Weighted Euclidean tessellation (core) ‚Äî weighted_voronoi
text: points_sf sf POINT object containing generator locations attributes. weight_col Character. Name weight column points_sf. boundary Optional sf polygon defining tessellation domain. Used template_rast NULL. template_rast Optional terra::SpatRaster template raster. Provide instead boundary + res. res Numeric. Raster resolution CRS units (e.g. metres). weight_transform Function. Transforms weights allocation. Must return finite, strictly positive values. method Character. Allocation method; one "argmin" "partition". max_dist Optional numeric. Maximum Euclidean distance consider (euclidean ). verbose Logical. TRUE, prints progress. island_min_cells Integer. Minimum patch size used island removal. island_fill_iter Integer. Maximum iterations filling reassigned cells.

title: Weighted Euclidean tessellation (core) ‚Äî weighted_voronoi
text: list containing polygon output (requested), allocation raster, weights.

what: Weighted tessellation in a constrained polygon domain ‚Äî weighted_voronoi_domain
title: Weighted tessellation in a constrained polygon domain ‚Äî weighted_voronoi_domain
text: Creates complete, connected tessellation polygonal domain using either weighted Euclidean distance weighted geodesic (domain-constrained) distance. Weights supplied attribute generator points can transformed user-defined function prior allocation.

title: Weighted tessellation in a constrained polygon domain ‚Äî weighted_voronoi_domain
code: weighted_voronoi_domain(   points_sf,   weight_col,   boundary_sf,   res = 20,   weight_transform = function(w) w,   distance = c("euclidean", "geodesic"),   max_dist = NULL,   island_min_cells = 5,   island_fill_iter = 50,   clip_to_boundary = TRUE,   close_mask = TRUE,   close_iters = 1,   dem_rast = NULL,   use_tobler = TRUE,   tobler_v0_kmh = 6,   tobler_a = 3.5,   tobler_b = 0.05,   min_speed_kmh = 0.25,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Weighted tessellation in a constrained polygon domain ‚Äî weighted_voronoi_domain
text: points_sf sf POINT object containing generator locations attributes. weight_col Character. Name weight column points_sf. boundary_sf sf POLYGON/MULTIPOLYGON defining domain. res Numeric. Raster resolution CRS units (e.g. metres). weight_transform Function. Transforms weights allocation. Must return finite, strictly positive values. distance Character. One "euclidean" "geodesic". max_dist Optional numeric. Maximum Euclidean distance consider (euclidean ). island_min_cells Integer. Minimum patch size used island removal. island_fill_iter Integer. Maximum iterations filling reassigned cells. clip_to_boundary Logical. TRUE, polygon output intersected input boundary exact edge matching (euclidean ). close_mask Logical. TRUE, applies morphological closing raster mask (geodesic ). close_iters Integer. Number closing iterations (geodesic ). dem_rast Optional SpatRaster providing elevation resistance surface. Must align tessellation domain resolution. use_tobler Logical; TRUE, apply Tobler's hiking function convert slope isotropic movement cost. tobler_v0_kmh Base walking speed flat terrain (km/h). tobler_a Tobler exponential slope coefficient (default -3.5). tobler_b Tobler slope multiplier (default 0.05). min_speed_kmh Minimum allowed speed avoid infinite costs. verbose Logical. TRUE, prints progress.

title: Weighted tessellation in a constrained polygon domain ‚Äî weighted_voronoi_domain
text: list elements including: polygons sf object one polygon per generator. allocation terra::SpatRaster assigning cell generator. summary generator-level summary table. diagnostics list diagnostic metrics settings.

title: Weighted tessellation in a constrained polygon domain ‚Äî weighted_voronoi_domain
text: distance = "geodesic", distances computed shortest paths constrained spatial domain. dem_rast supplied use_tobler = TRUE, movement cost adjacent raster cells modified using Tobler's hiking function, steeper slopes increase effective distance. allows elevation resistance surfaces influence spatial allocation preserving complete tessellation.

title: Weighted tessellation in a constrained polygon domain ‚Äî weighted_voronoi_domain
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(sf) crs_use <- 32636 boundary_sf <- st_sf(   geometry = st_sfc(st_polygon(list(rbind(     c(0,0), c(1000,0), c(1000,1000), c(0,1000), c(0,0)   )))),   crs = crs_use ) points_sf <- st_sf(   population = c(50, 200, 1000),   geometry = st_sfc(st_point(c(200,200)), st_point(c(800,250)), st_point(c(500,500))),   crs = crs_use ) out <- weighted_voronoi_domain(points_sf, "population", boundary_sf,   res = 20, weight_transform = log10, distance = "euclidean", verbose = FALSE ) } # }

title: Weighted geodesic tessellation (core) ‚Äî weighted_voronoi_geodesic
text: Computes weighted tessellation using domain-constrained (geodesic) distances. Distances calculated shortest-path distances rasterised domain mask.

title: Weighted geodesic tessellation (core) ‚Äî weighted_voronoi_geodesic
code: weighted_voronoi_geodesic(   points_sf,   weight_col,   boundary_sf,   res = 20,   weight_transform = function(w) w,   close_mask = TRUE,   close_iters = 1,   dem_rast = NULL,   use_tobler = TRUE,   tobler_v0_kmh = 6,   tobler_a = 3.5,   tobler_b = 0.05,   min_speed_kmh = 0.25,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Weighted geodesic tessellation (core) ‚Äî weighted_voronoi_geodesic
text: points_sf sf POINT object containing generator locations attributes. weight_col Character. Name weight column points_sf. boundary_sf sf POLYGON/MULTIPOLYGON defining domain. res Numeric. Raster resolution CRS units (e.g. metres). weight_transform Function. Transforms weights allocation. Must return finite, strictly positive values. close_mask Logical. TRUE, applies morphological closing raster mask (geodesic ). close_iters Integer. Number closing iterations (geodesic ). dem_rast Optional SpatRaster providing elevation resistance surface. Must align tessellation domain resolution. use_tobler Logical; TRUE, apply Tobler's hiking function convert slope isotropic movement cost. tobler_v0_kmh Base walking speed flat terrain (km/h). tobler_a Tobler exponential slope coefficient (default -3.5). tobler_b Tobler slope multiplier (default 0.05). min_speed_kmh Minimum allowed speed avoid infinite costs. verbose Logical. TRUE, prints progress.

title: Weighted geodesic tessellation (core) ‚Äî weighted_voronoi_geodesic
text: list containing polygon output, allocation raster, weights.
